message: Wishing you all a very Happy New Year! I look forward to continuing to work for the good people of the 26th District of Texas and working with my fellow Republicans in Congress to advance the conservative cause and do the people’s business in 2017.

Reforming the currently flawed health care system will be a top priority as the new Congress is sworn in on Tuesday, January 3.  Watch my interview with Fox News Mornings with Maria on our approach to repeal and replace ObamaCare >> http://bit.ly/2hIcyxE #BetterWay
As we prepare to begin a new Congress, make sure you don't miss any news from Washington. Sign up for my weekly newsletter here >> http://bit.ly/2hIck4S

Congratulations to Tracy Murphee who was sworn in as the new Sheriff of the Denton County Sheriff's Office this week. As a former Texas Ranger and committed law enforcement officer, I am confident Sheriff Murphee will successfully take on the great task of protecting our community and serving the people of Denton County, Texas.

Today I took the oath of office to support & defend the Constitution as I prepare to represent the constituents of #TX26 during the 115th Congress. I am honored to serve another term as your voice in the people's house.

Be sure to visit my newly designed and more user-friendly website where I can assist you with everything from learning more about what’s going on in Washington to helping you get in contact with a federal agency. Connect with me on my new website here >> http://bit.ly/2hIck4S  You can also stay connected by signing up for my weekly email updates >>http://bit.ly/2hR7H8N
In case you missed it: I joined Fox & Friends this morning to discuss the Republican plan to deliver on our promise to fix the broken health care system.

The American people are tired of Washington, DC messing with their health insurance. It’s time to return power to the states and put patients back in the driver’s seat to choose the coverage that works best for them and their families. The American people spoke when they elected a Republican Congress and White House. It is time for a full repeal of this 'train-wreck' system.  Learn more about our plan to repeal and replace ObamaCare here >> http://bit.ly/2jcuooL

Today we express our gratitude to the heroes in blue who put their lives on the line daily to protect us. With 135 law enforcement officers lost in 2016, the sacrifices made by these selfless men and women to ensure our safety are more apparent now than ever before. Join me in thanking and recognizing our exemplary members of our law enforcement. #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay

Today the House of Representatives passed my bill to improve access to maternity care in areas of the country that are experiencing a shortage of health care providers. Consistent, high-quality maternity care is of the utmost importance for both mothers and babies to ensure a safe, healthy pregnancy.

I am honored to have been appointed as the Chairman of the Health Subcommittee of the House Committee on Energy and Commerce. A lot of hard work lies ahead of us in the coming weeks. Along with Chairman Greg Walden and the other members of the Subcommittee, I am committed and prepared to take on this great endeavor. Read my full statement on my website here >> http://bit.ly/2jcsB2W

With the 58th Presidential Inauguration just 10 days away, we look  back on the roles #Texans have played in these momentous events, that have shaped and strengthened our country.   In President George H. W. Bush's inaugural address in 1989 he stated, “And so, there is much to do. And tomorrow the work begins. And I do not mistrust the future. I do not fear what is ahead. For our problems are large, but our heart is larger. Our challenges are great, but our will is greater. And if our flaws are endless, God's love is truly boundless.”

Fun #Inauguration Fact: In 1953, Texas-born President Dwight D. Eisenhower was lassoed by a cowboy while watching the parade following his inauguration as the 34th President of the United States. #inauguration2017 #Texas
It was an honor to meet with Texas veterans and Purple Heart recipients today. Thank you for your service to our nation. You’re among the best our nation has to offer. #TX26

Last night the House of Representatives passed the Regulatory Accountability Act, legislation to reduce overbearing federal regulation & create greater transparency: the very definition of accountable government. http://giphy.com/gifs/regulatory-reform-l0JMpawCf5lxDYNW0

The view from behind the podium as Texan, Lyndon B. Johnson, is sworn in as the 36th President of the United States in 1965. This photo was taken from the east front of the United States Capitol building, facing the Supreme Court and Library of Congress.   President Ronald Reagan was the first to be inaugurated on the west front of the Capitol, facing the National Mall. #Inauguration2017
Today we honor a man of great courage and conviction, Martin Luther King Jr, and we remember his life dedication to justice, equality & peace. #MLKday2017

Nearly $2 billion were lost in the failed #Obamacare CO-OP experiment. Eighteen of the original 23 CO-OPs have closed,  leaving vulnerable patients with fewer places to turn for help. More here >> http://bit.ly/2je5iqj
I extend my deepest sympathy and prayers to Little Elm Police Department's Detective Jerry Walker's loved ones. My statement on his brave service here >> http://bit.ly/2j9DFyg
Next week I'll be sending out a constituent priority survey for the 115th Congress. Be sure to sign up for my weekly video newsletter in order to participate >> http://bit.ly/2dAvvjy
My office is buzzing with #TX26 residents picking up their tickets for the historic #Inauguration2017, only one day away.

Today is an important day in our nation's history. It is a celebration of the peaceful transition of power, a pillar of our democracy. Read my statement on the inauguration of President Trump here >> http://bit.ly/2k9HbJe

Yesterday, I joined NBC DFW's Lone Star Politics to discuss last Friday's historic inauguration of President Trump and Vice President Pence and why I am optimistic about the agenda of the Trump Administration.
It was great to visit with so many #TX26 residents while they were in Washington, D.C. to attend the Presidential Inauguration of President Donald J. Trump & Vice President Mike Pence.

This afternoon, I honored the memory of the fallen member of the Little Elm Police Department Detective Jerry Walker on the floor of the House of Representatives. His dedication to service and our community will not soon be forgotten.
My favorite Monday meeting with a future Chairman of the House Committee on Energy and Commerce Subcommittee on Health.

Border security has been a top priority of mine since I joined Congress. It's time it is a national priority.  Read my statement on President Trump's executive action on immigration here >> http://bit.ly/2jSBMY3

Tomorrow, thousands will gather in Washington, D.C. at The March for Life to demand respect for life at every stage and remember the over 58 million lives that have been lost to abortion since the ruling of Roe v Wade.  As a physician I am dedicated to protecting both mother and child, before birth and after. Human rights begin when life begins. #whywemarch #marchforlife.
My statement on President Trump's executive order which names the same seven countries identified by intelligence gathered by the Obama Administration as sources of terror >> http://bit.ly/2k73PD6

The restoration of the United States Capitol rotunda was recently completed and is ready for visitors. The restoration work ensures this historic building will remain a symbol of freedom and democracy for generations to come. Contact my office to plan your visit to our nation's capital >> http://bit.ly/1sqb2Bi

It was a pleasure catching up with Denton Independent School District, Lewisville ISD and Frisco Independent School District school board officials this morning while they were in town for their annual meeting.

I joined House Committee on Energy and Commerce Chairman Greg Walden to discuss health care reform and the steps Republicans are taking to ensure those harmed by the Affordable Care Act will receive the help they so desperately need. The coming month will be an extremely busy one in #HealthSub, but we are working for and with the American people to rebuild this broken system and provide everyone with health care that best fits them.   Read our op-ed here >> http://bit.ly/2jz8Sug
I commend President Trump on his outstanding nomination of Judge Gorsuch to the U.S. Supreme Court. Read my statement here >> http://bit.ly/2keEbws

I always enjoy meeting with fellow physicians to discuss the issues facing them in their daily practice and how we can help them better care for their patients as we look towards the future of health care. Thank you to the members of the Medical Association of the State of Alabama for allowing me to speak to you all today.

Today, we remember the 7 crew members who lost their lives aboard the Columbia Space Shuttle. This tragedy hit especially close to home as many Texans awoke to learn, not only, about the tragedy in our skies, but the loss of a fellow Texan. The courage of these men and women and their sacrifice will not be forgotten.

In 2015, Governor Greg Abbott set February 2 as Chris Kyle Day. Today, we honor a #Texas legend and great American hero who selflessly dedicated his life to the service of our nation. http://bit.ly/2jZwidr
I sat down with the Texas Tribune to discuss the path forward to fix our broken health care system. Read the piece here >> http://bit.ly/2l12Wv6
Happy Birthday to a great American and a true conservative, former President Ronald Reagan.

I spent the morning at The University of Texas at Dallas discussing how we plan to rebuild our healthcare by repealing the hurtful ACA, replacing it step-by-step, and delivering relief to the American people.

ICYMI: I joined C-SPAN's Washington Journal to discuss the steps Congress is already taking to rebuild our health care system.  We all know the damage the ACA has done on our health care system, which is why our committee is hard at work crafting language to repeal it. We can’t rebuild our health care system without first saving the individual market from total collapse to ultimately protect patients, lower costs and improve patient choice.

Despite the continued rhetoric from House Democrats on the "success" of Obamacare, a Congressional Research Service (CRS) report confirms that House Democrats have voted repeatedly with Republicans to repeal, modify, delay or defund all or parts of #Obamacare.

#TBT Last February, I joined fellow Border Security Caucus members to tour the Rio Grande Valley Sector of the U.S.-Mexico Border. The flow of unaccompanied minors into our state put a strain on many Texas communities and the haphazard opening of our border is a national security crisis.   While we still face many difficulties in securing our borders, I am optimistic that swift action is being taken by President Trump and Congress to prioritize the safety of our citizens by securing our borders.

In case you missed it >> I joined Fox & Friends this morning to discuss Governor Greg Abbott's efforts to halt sanctuary cities and how Congress plans to deliver relief to American families from the damage that the ACA caused.

Our goal is to stabilize the insurance markets in the process of returning our health care to a patient-centered system. We are committed to providing patients with a strong-functioning marketplace that encourages patients to get covered and stay covered.

Congratulations to fellow member of the Congressional Doctors Caucus & my friend Rep. Tom Price on his confirmation as Secretary of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. He is truly the right person at the right time.

In my weekly video address, I discuss the President's nomination of Judge Gorsuch to the U.S. Supreme Court bench.   If you don't currently receive my weekly newsletter and you are interested, you can sign up here >> bit.ly/2dAvvjy
Today we remember the unparalleled service to our nation & conservative legacy of Justice Scalia, a true defender of the U.S. Constitution.

Thank you to all who joined my telephone town hall last night. With over 3,000 North Texans on the phone, we discussed our health care system, national security, immigration, veterans access to care, tax reform, and more. Be sure to visit my website at www.burgess.house.gov to sign up for my weekly video newsletter to stay up to date on my work as your representative in Congress.

My staff delivered the valentine's day cards that the students at Denton Independent School District's Providence Elementary School and Navo Middle School made for patients at the Dallas VA Medical Center. Thank you to all those students who helped put a smile on the face of all our veterans.

I was honored to join Operation Finally Home to help welcome the Jantz family to their new home in our community. SSG Travis Jantz served several tours in the U.S. Army. On behalf of a grateful nation, I thank SSG Jantz and his wife Kristen for all the sacrifices they have made for our country.
Today we honor all those who have served and led our country in the highest office. Happy Presidents' Day!

In case you missed it: I joined Greta Van Susteren on "For the Record" to discuss Congress' path forward to rebuild our failing health care system, beginning with the repeal and replacement of Obamacare.
As Seema Verma prepares to be confirmed by the Senate, I lay out why she is the most qualified to lead the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services in an op-ed in USA TODAY → http://usat.ly/2kZQWcN

Today marks the 72nd anniversary of the iconic American moment when five U.S. Marine Corps Marines and a U.S. Navy hospital corpsman raised an American flag atop Mt. Suribachi, during the Battle of Iwo Jima.  The Battle of Iwo Jima was a turning point in World War II, testing the abiding resilience and perseverance of the U.S. forces.
In my weekly address video, I discuss the steps being taken by the Department of Homeland Security to strengthen our border while still allowing legal immigration into the United States. Watch here ↓

This morning I joined CNN New Day to discuss the work Congress is doing to make health insurance affordable for all Americans and how we are empowering Americans to make their own decisions about their health care. Watch here ↓
This Saturday, March 4th at 9am I will be hosting my 98th town hall meeting at Marcus High School. More information → http://bit.ly/2mC3md7

I enjoyed hearing from Michael J. Fox about all the important work his Foundation is doing to find a cure for Parkinson's Disease. We presented him with a copy of the 21st Century Cures Act, which was signed into law last year and will put lifesaving cures into the hands of patients who need them most.
This evening, President Trump delivered an optimistic message for all Americans. My statement on the President's Joint Address to Congress here: http://bit.ly/2lwRU1n

On March 2, 1836, 59 brave men signed their names to a document declaring Texas' independence from Mexico and refusal to be oppressed or held down for any longer. That same frontier spirit lives on in the hearts of the people of Texas and I could not be more proud to serve our great state. #TexasIndependenceDay #TexasHistoryMonth

It's only fitting that our former Texas Governor Rick Perry is confirmed by the Senate to be the next Secretary of Energy on Texas Independence Day. Congratulations to Secretary Perry on this great honor → http://bit.ly/2m0Y7nb
‪If you are unable to attend my town hall meeting tomorrow morning, it will be available on the livestream here >> http://bit.ly/2mpqvCd
My 98th town hall meeting has begun. Watch it live here >> http://bit.ly/2mpqvCd
If you are having trouble accessing the livestream, please try refreshing the page. The livestream is up and running >> http://bit.ly/2mpqvCd
Thank you to everyone who attended my town hall meeting this morning. We had an important & productive conversation about the issues facing Americans today. #TX26

For far too long Americans have been crushed under the weight of the ACA. Since day one of this law’s implementation, we’ve found that almost every promise President Obama made was empty. American families were dropped from plans and premiums continue to rise. The industry as a whole has been stymied by taxes and overregulation. The damage ends here.   We just introduced our bill to repeal and replace Obamacare. This plan will make health insurance affordable for all Americans, protecting young people on their parent's insurance and those with pre-existing conditions. We are empowering Americans to make their own decisions about their health care  From here, the bill will now go through regular order as it makes its way through the legislative process, starting with a mark-up in the House Committee on Energy and Commerce on Wednesday.   Read more on our bill here → http://www.ReadTheBill.gop
On this day in 1901, the Texas legislature proclaimed the bluebonnet the state flower. #TexasHistoryMonth

I joined Varney & Co. on Fox Business this morning to discuss the bill to provide immediate relief from the ACA and deliver on our promise to ensure a stable transition and that no one has the rug pulled out from under them.

The ACA is nothing shy of a failed political & social experiment that ignored the needs & will of millions of Americans—to those people I say “We hear you.” We're taking the next step to deliver on our promise to the American people of affordable health care while preserving critical patient protections. #RepealAndReplace

I have personally experienced the frustration of enrolling through the ACA exchanges for insurance coverage.   In 2009, I was told by the Obama Administration that my insurance plan was not good enough and that they knew better than me. And I lost my plan after being promised that I could keep my plan if I liked my plan. I chose to opt out of the insurance that was provided to members of Congress and instead I enrolled though the fallback exchanges in the state of Texas. It was important that I went through the same process that everyone in my district was going through.  This was the absolute worst insurance I have ever had. The unbelievable high cost of my deductible made the insurance nearly unusable. It was this experience that led me to believe there must be a better way >> http://bit.ly/2mZ83Oq
We know it will take more than one bill to build a better, patient-centered health system. Reform will occur in 3 phases ↓ #RepealAndReplace

After a 27 hour markup, I am proud of the work and commitment of the members of the House Committee on Energy and Commerce to move the American Health Care Act forward and deliver on our promise of affordable care for all Americans. Next step → House Budget Committee GOP
Today President Trump submitted his 2018 budget blueprint aimed at reducing the size of the federal government. My statement here >> http://bit.ly/2mStZMZ
Ahead of the vote on the rule, I went down to the House of Representatives floor to speak on the American Health Care Act and how it will help all Americans suffering under the ACA. #PassTheBill

Thanks to the Association of American Medical Colleges for allowing me to address your Council of Teaching Hospitals and Health Systems (COTH) this afternoon. It's always great to visit with representatives from hospitals in the great state of Texas. #TX26

I was honored to receive the National Association of Community Health Centers' 2017 Distinguished Community Health Defender Award for my work advocating for health centers in #TX26. It is critical that our nation's health centers have the resources they need to best serve their patients.
Today is National Doctors Day, which is observed in honor of Georgian Dr. Crawford Long who was the first to use ether as an anesthetic in surgery on March 30, 1842 #NationalDoctorsDay
Mark Your Calendars: I will be hosting my annual Emergency Preparedness Summit & Fair on Saturday, April 8 at Lewisville High School from 8 AM-12 PM. More information here: http://bit.ly/23pdvJb
On Saturday, April 22nd at 9am I will be hosting my 99th town hall meeting at Harvest Church in Fort Worth. More information → http://bit.ly/2n7RseQ
My statement on the chemical weapons attack that occurred Tuesday in northwestern Syria >> http://bit.ly/2o1d8Xg

It was a great pleasure to have the chance to visit with Blake, owner of Blake's Snow Shack, while he was in Washington for the National Down Syndrome Society Buddy Walk.  I had the chance to stop by Blake's Snow Shack in Sanger last June. It's always great to see young, entrepreneurs succeeding in #TX26.

The event that occurred in Syria earlier this week is astonishing in its cruelty. President Trump made the correct decision to take decisive action against the Assad regime. Before further military action is taken, it is Congress’ obligation to authorize war powers through the structure and debate of an Authorization for Use of Military Force (AUMF). Read my statement >> http://bit.ly/2nTiqmM
REMINDER: I'll be hosting my annual #TX26 #Emergency Preparedness Summit this Saturday April 8 at Lewisville High School from 8am - 12pm. More information here → bit.ly/23pdvJb
Unable to attend my #Emergency Preparedness Summit this morning? Watch it live here >> http://bit.ly/2o9FazK

Thanks to all who attended my annual Emergency Preparedness Summit on Saturday morning. Residents of #TX26 had the opportunity to learn from the experts about putting emergency plans in place to keep themselves and their families safe. Thank you also to all the emergency responders who participated in the summit.
Voting for the #TX26 Congressional Art Competition has begun. Visit my website to vote for your favorite piece here >> http://bit.ly/2oSfYBj

For students interested in applying to the U.S. service academies, we will be hosting a forum on Saturday, April 29 from 8AM-12PM to share information about our nation's service academies, requirements for admission and the selection process. We hope to see you there. More information on the forum here: http://bit.ly/2p41prf
Reminder: On Saturday, April 22nd at 9am I will be hosting my 99th town hall meeting at Harvest Church in Fort Worth. More information → http://bit.ly/2n7RseQ
ICYMI:  I joined Special Report with Bret Baier to follow up on a complicated healthcare story http://bit.ly/2oP9QZo

For students interested in applying to the U.S. service academies, we will be hosting a forum on Saturday, April 29 from 8AM-12PM to share information about our nation's service academies, requirements for admission and the selection process. We hope to see you there. More information on the forum here: http://bit.ly/2p41prf
Thank you President Trump and Gov. Christie for asking me to participate in yesterday’s White House Opioid Listening Session

Congratulations to the winners of the 2017 Congressional High School District Art Competition. It’s a privilege to honor Scout Streit from Marcus High School, Ashlyn Brightly of Flower Mound High School, and Julia Adkins of Flower Mound High School for their great art submissions. Read more about the competition here: https://burgess.house.gov/blog/?postid=398389
In my weekly address video, I discuss the importance of remembering American service men and women on Memorial Day, and ensuring that veterans receive the best possible care.
In this Memorial Day Address, I thank the many service members from North Texas and around the country who bear the burden of protecting our liberty and freedom.
I was glad to attend yesterday's “Serving our Heroes Day” at Prestonwood Baptist Church in Plano. Thanks for your work to honor our heroes.

Today I had the opportunity to honor the students from the 26th District who have been appointed to our service academies. I’m grateful that these future leaders have accepted this challenge to serve their country, and wish them the best as they start at the academies this summer.
I am grateful for the service and bravery of those who sacrificed for our freedom on the beaches of Normandy 73 years ago on D-Day.
The FDA Reauthorization Act will help groundbreaking cures reach patients faster and increase competition in the marketplace. Watch my take on this big win for patients. https://youtu.be/K44CkVjRj1M

Last week I visited our southern border in McAllen, Texas to  talk with Customs and Border Protection about issues facing Texas. Thank you to the U.S. Border Patrol for your hard work along our border.
In today's new Weekly Video Address: President Trump's decision to withdraw from the Paris Accord is an important action to keep American workers at the focus of the economy.

Today Jerry Drew from the 26th District and CEO of Network Thermostat participated in the House Committee on Energy and Commerce's Internet of Things Showcase. It was great to hear about innovation and technology at Network Thermostat.

Today I am praying for Whip Scalise and others affected by this morning's event. On days like today, we can all help contribute in some way to help our fellow Americans. I took some time to donate blood at the American Red Cross.
In today's weekly video address, I reflect on the Congressional Baseball Game as a display of sportsmanship and unity among Members of Congress who represent Americans from shore to shore.
On Father's Day, I am grateful for all the men who encourage the next generation. I hope all the dads in #TX26 have a great day.
In case you missed it, last night I joined Chris Hayes to discuss next steps for fixing American health care. Watch the full segment -->  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_y7JFFxa9I8

Yesterday the House Energy and Commerce Subcommittee on Health held a bipartisan member briefing to learn more about the rising rates of maternal mortality in America. The death of a new or expecting mother is a tragic event that devastates everyone involved. Having spent nearly three decades as an OB-GYN, I believe it should be a national goal to eliminate all preventable maternal mortality—even a single maternal death is too many. As Chairman of the Subcommittee on Health, I will continue to seek solutions for this serious problem that we simply cannot ignore.
As we reflect on Independence Day and the freedom we enjoy as Americans, we should recognize the men and women in uniform who sacrifice for our freedom.

Happy Independence Day! Not that long ago, our forefathers envisioned a land of freedom and liberty, in which individuals could fulfill their God-given potential. Those ideas indeed changed the course of history forever. Today and every day I am grateful for the Americans throughout our nation’s history who have sacrificed for the freedom we enjoy.

Last week I spoke on the House Floor in memory of the five Dallas Police officers who were killed in the line of duty on July 7, 2016. We all should take time this week to remember their sacrifice, bravery, and courage in the line of duty to protect strangers.

One year after five Dallas Police officers were lost in the line of duty, we must remember their sacrifice, bravery, and courage in the face of danger to protect strangers. I am grateful for the men and women in uniform who stand guard over North Texas each day.
It was great to join Governor Abbott, Rep. Johnson, and Toyota North America CEO Jim Lentz in Plano at the grand opening of Toyota North America’s new HQ.

I’m hosting the annual Energy Summit & Fair at UNT Discovery Park this Saturday, July 15 between 8am and 12pm. This is a great opportunity to hear from experts on how to reduce your energy use and save money on energy costs. Join us! More info: https://burgess.house.gov/energysummit/.

In his 2003 State of the Union Address, President George W. Bush predicted that American innovation in energy would lead to hydrogen-powered cars. This Saturday, you can drive one at my Energy Summit & Fair. Join us at UNT Discovery Park between 8am and 12pm. More --> https://burgess.house.gov/energysummit/

A full audit of the Pentagon will make it clear how much we have spent, what we bought with our money, and what we need for the future. Read my USA Today op-ed with Grover Norquist for more on why we must provide for America’s national defense while still being responsible with taxpayer dollars.

I'm hosting my annual Energy Summit & Fair this morning at UNT Discovery Park between 8am and 12pm. Join us to hear how you can reduce your energy costs. For more details, visit  https://burgess.house.gov/energysummit/.
It was great to see innovative technology, like this hydrogen-powered car, that will help us reduce energy use and save on costs today. Thanks to those who came to this year's Energy Summit & Fair.
In case you missed it, read my USA TODAY op-ed with Grover Norquist on why we need to audit the Pentagon. The national defense is too important to remain a black box.
This morning I joined MSNBC to discuss the future of health care reform. Watch the full interview here: https://youtu.be/kg9PhA0I1Rc.

Yesterday I had the honor and privilege of welcoming Guest Chaplain Marshall Dunbar of Crossroads, TX to open the House in prayer. You can watch his prayer here: https://youtu.be/LhwF9T-hV2E, and my remarks on the House floor here: https://youtu.be/-kWXnipvpcE.

The Senate's motion to proceed to debate on health care reform is a positive step forward in our efforts to dismantle Obamacare, a law that has been disastrous for American patients and providers. As we move forward, I will continue to work toward a better health care system that benefits American patients and those who work in the health care industry. Read my full statement below.
Last night I was up late on the House Floor for appropriations debate. #TBT to when I used to stay up late delivering babies. In both cases, it's all about the future.
This morning, we heard an interesting discussion from Dan Rather at Lake Dallas High School for the 3rd Annual Lake Dallas ISD Community Leader Breakfast.

I'm hosting my 100th Town Hall Meeting on Thursday, August 3 at 7:00pm at the Denton ISD/Braswell High School Gymnasium located at 26750 E. University Drive, Aubrey, TX 76227. For more information, see the event flyer: https://burgess.house.gov/UploadedFiles/TH_Flyer__August_3_2017.pdf

Join me at a Town Hall Meeting this Saturday, August 5, from 9:00am - 10:30am at the Lewisville ISD/The Colony High School Auditorium located at 4301 Blair Oaks Drive, The Colony, TX, 75056. More information: https://goo.gl/bFhGxB.
I'm hosting my 100th Town Hall Meeting tonight at 7:00pm-8:30pm in the Braswell High School Gym. If you're unable to join us, you can watch live here: https://youtu.be/qZSROMK_A6E

This morning, I am holding a Town Hall Meeting at The Colony High School Auditorium from 9am - 10:30am. If you can't join us, you can watch the livestream here: https://youtu.be/Fpb5ivA9RPU

In case you missed it, last week the Senate passed the FDA Reauthorization Act of 2017. Earlier this summer, I discussed why this legislation is a big win for our patients and American innovation. Watch the full clip: https://youtu.be/K44CkVjRj1M.
Big news for North Texas --> Denton County is the fastest growing county in America, at a projected 4.1% economic growth over the next 5 years. See more from CBS News.
This morning it was good to talk with leaders from Denton ISD and local businesses at the Denton Chamber of Commerce's Business over Breakfast meeting.
‪Americans must stand united against hatred. I am sad to hear of losses suffered today in Charlottesville, and am praying for all affected.

I agree with President Trump that any display of racism and violence by the KKK, neo-Nazis, white supremacists, and other hate groups is fundamentally and inherently evil and wrong. Watch my full message on the importance of strengthening our political discourse, a key tenet of American democracy.  https://youtu.be/Q9ElLTRaxrw.
I had the pleasure of joining local community leaders at the NE Tarrant County Chamber of Commerce luncheon today to discuss growth in NE Tarrant County.
Today President Trump signed the FDA Reauthorization Act of 2017 into law. Read my statement on this important, bipartisan legislation: https://goo.gl/iC2qUt
Last night it was great to help kick off the Highland Village Lions Club 30th Annual Balloon Festival.
Get ready! The solar eclipse will cross the 26th District around 1:10pm CT, when the moon will cover 76% of the sun.

It’s difficult to understand the southern border unless you see it for yourself. I appreciate President Trump’s return to the border today, and his visit with the many Customs and Border Protection officers that secure our nation.

As you're preparing for Hurricane #Harvey, here are FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency resources you can use to stay connected for real time information on the storm.   - Download the FEMA App to locate and get directions to open shelters across the state, and receive weather alerts from the National Weather Service for up to five different locations anywhere in the United States.    - Follow FEMA on Twitter (https://twitter.com/fema) and Faceook (http://www.facebook.com/fema).   - Monitor local radio or TV stations for updated emergency information, and follow the instructions of state and local officials.

Today at FEMA’s Region 6 headquarters in Denton, I was briefed on FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency's efforts to help the many Texans affected by Hurricane Harvey, and I am grateful for their hard work for our neighbors in Houston.
At the mega-shelter in the Dallas Convention Center, UT Southwestern Medical Center's Dr. Ray Fowler and other volunteers briefed me on their work to help Hurricane #Harvey victims.
Today I had a great time talking with students from Pilot Point Intermediate School about issues that are important to these young North Texans.
In this video address, I reflect on the effects of Hurricane Harvey - including the availability of fuel - as well as the compassion shown by the entire Texas community in the wake of disaster.
Today I met with Secretary Ben Carson to discuss  U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development's work to support Texans - especially veterans, the homeless, & those affected by Hurricane Harvey.
Americans rallied behind Texans after Hurricane Harvey, and we offer our support to those in the path of Hurricane Irma.
As we mark the 16th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks, we remember the lives lost on that day and Americans' united front against evil.
On Saturday, I joined Building Homes For Heroes to help welcome Army Sergeant Kody Wilson and his family to their new home. Learn more: https://goo.gl/b24ziX.
On September 11th, I am thinking of my friends at American Airlines and all who lost loved ones on 9/11. We will #NeverForget.
This week I met with The University of Texas at Dallas Medical Management students to discuss the current health care landscape - and my own days at UT Dallas!
On POW/MIA Recognition Day, we honor the brave service members who have sacrificed for our freedom.
This week I joined Jason Whitely for WFAA's Inside Texas Politics. Tune in tomorrow morning to watch.
On Constitution Day, we celebrate the Framers and generations of #WeThePeople who have upheld our government of, by, and for the people.

Today I joined Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services Administrator Seema Verma, HHS Region 6 Regional Director Dr. David Teuscher, Dr. Jeffrey Kalina, and Dr. Horacio E. Adrogue at Dialyspa in Houston.
It's Prescription Opioid & Heroin Epidemic Awareness Week. The House Energy and Commerce Committee is working to combat this crisis: https://energycommerce.house.gov/opioids/
Shanah Tovah to all celebrating #RoshHashanah. I wish you a happy and healthy year ahead.
This weekend I had a productive conversation with Rep. Cuellar at #TribFest17. Thanks to the Texas Tribune for hosting us.(photo credit: Bob Daemmrich)
At our #TaxReform retreat yesterday, Vice President Pence thanked the House for passing the American Health Care Act, and said health care reform is a matter of "not if, but when."
The last time Congress passed #TaxReform, my job was a little different. Now it's time for more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks. #TBT

This fall, we are working on #TaxReform that will focus on hardworking families and put our country on the path to long term economic stability. Here’s the bottom line: Tax reform will be pro-growth, pro-jobs, pro-workers, and pro-American.
Read my statement thanking Secretary Tom Price for his service to the Department of Health and Human Services.

Today the Energy and Commerce DCCP Subcommittee held a hearing on the Equifax breach. Read my opening statement: http://bit.ly/2xXjWfr.    If you have been affected by the breach, FTC has steps you should take now.
Last night the House Energy and Commerce Committee advanced nine key health bills, including the HEALTHY KIDS Act to extend funding for SCHIP. Read my full statement --> http://bit.ly/2xl2Swh
Today I joined Rep. Jenniffer González in Puerto Rico to discuss the status of the island’s medical capabilities following recent hurricanes.
I spent a productive day Monday listening to concerns of physicians, nurses, and hospital administrators in Puerto Rico with Rep. Jenniffer González-Colón.
Tune into the Subcommittee on Health Member Day to hear from Members of Congress on how the #opioidcrisis is impacting American communities.
This week the House passed a disaster relief bill that includes $15 billion to help Texans recovering from Hurricane Harvey.
This morning I joined FOX 4 to discuss my recent trip to Puerto Rico and the latest health care news.
I recently joined Fox News to discuss how recent changes to health care will offer Americans relief from Obamacare.
Too many families have been affected by the opioid crisis. Congress is working on bipartisan, commonsense solutions to help end this epidemic.
It was great to meet talented University of North Texas student Trinity Kai, a winner of the 2017 VSA Emerging Artists Program at The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.
This week's vote to pass a budget is another step toward more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks.

Tomorrow is National Prescription Drug #DEATakeBack Day. Find the closest prescription drug collection site to you by visiting the Drug Enforcement Administration website: https://takebackday.dea.gov/
This weekend, I had the opportunity to introduce helicopter pilot Ross Perot Jr. and astronaut Senator Bill Nelson at the National Aviation Hall of Fame Dinner in Fort Worth.

I was sorry to hear the news of Mayor Olive Stephens’ passing. Mayor Stephens is a North Texas icon and role model for public service, and I am grateful for her longtime service to Shady Shores. We will miss her leadership in our North Texas community.
The CHAMPIONING HEALTHY KIDS Act includes priorities that will help North Texans, and Americans across the country, who rely on vital health services like CHIP.
Today the House voted to fund important public health priorities, including CHIP, that will help North Texans and all Americans who rely on these vital health services.
This morning we gathered in Denton Square to honor our veterans here in North Texas and around the country. Our nation is indebted to them.
Today it was an honor to recognize five North Texas veterans, pictured left to right: Paul Perez, Jr., Donald Graves, Paul Farrar, Johnnie Yellock II, and Donald Phillips.

On #VeteransDay, we honor the many men and women who have served our nation. Please join me in thanking the veterans in North Texas and around the country who have put their lives on the line for our freedom.

The Pentagon should be held to the same level of accountability as other federal agencies when it comes to spending taxpayer dollars. My Audit the Pentagon amendment, which was included in the NDAA for Fiscal Year 2018, is a key measure for fiscal responsibility. http://bit.ly/2zYupJo

Last night I held a teletown hall meeting with almost 2,500 constituents from the 26th District to hear your concerns and ideas about tax reform. Thank you to those who took the time to join. As always, I value your input on this issue and every other issue that comes before the House.
Yesterday the House passed a major tax reform package for the first time since 1986. Today's weekly address breaks down several ways these reforms will help hardworking families here in North Texas.
As we take time to reflect on another year’s blessings, I wish you and your family a happy and safe Thanksgiving.

#TBT - One year ago the House passed the 21st Century Cures Act, a law that makes government an ally, rather than an obstacle, in the cycle of medical innovation. Today #SubHealth will hear from leaders at the helm of its implementation.
On the 76th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor, we remember the lives lost on December 7, 1941. Americans are indebted to the brave men and women who defended our freedom.

Last night I called more than 14,000 homes in the 26th District to hear your ideas on tax reform and other important issues. I had a productive conversation with constituents in Keller, Denton, Little Elm, and Argyle, among others. As always, I am grateful for your feedback & ideas.

Today I caught up with North Texas entrepreneurs and local leaders at Denton Chamber of Commerce's luncheon. It was also great to see former County Judge Jeff Moseley, now the head of the Texas Association of Business.
I wish everyone celebrating the Festival of Lights tonight a very happy Hanukkah.

Over the next the few days, I will be evaluating the tax reform conference report and how these proposed measures will affect North Texans. The tax bill is available in its entirety here: http://docs.house.gov/billsthisweek/20171218/CRPT-115HRPT-466.pdf

Today Congress will vote on comprehensive tax reform for the first time since 1986. Thirty-one years is far too long to wait to offer relief to hardworking American families. To learn more about these proposed changes, please take a look at this chart. https://burgess.house.gov/uploadedfiles/tax_cuts_and_jobs_act_12.18.2017.pdf

With today’s vote on tax reform, Congress is eliminating Obamacare’s individual mandate penalty – an egregious overreach of Americans’ personal freedom. This morning I spoke on the House Floor about this step to restore liberty to the American people. Watch now ⬇

Today Congress delivered on its promise to the American people by passing comprehensive tax reform for the first time since 1986. We also voted to eliminate Obamacare's individual mandate penalty. Watch this video address for more on how tax reform will benefit North Texas families.
As we prepare to celebrate the holidays, I wish you and your family a merry Christmas.
On this Christmas, I wish you and your family a happy, safe, and joyful holiday season.

At the end of each year, I publish a report detailing key services and accomplishments for the 26th District. As we look ahead to 2018, here’s a snapshot of 2017. Read my full report here: http://bit.ly/2pVA7Yo
